meanings.definition: In a strong or solid manner
meanings.sent1: She held onto the railing firmly to avoid falling.
meanings.sent2: The tree was firmly rooted in the ground.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat firmly on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: His beliefs were firmly planted in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The handshake was firmly gripping, showing confidence.

meanings.definition: In a resolute or determined manner
meanings.sent1: He firmly decided to pursue his dream of becoming a pilot.
meanings.sent2: She firmly stated her opinion during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The child firmly declared that they would finish all their vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The team was firmly committed to winning the championship.
meanings.sent5: The detective firmly followed the clues to solve the case.

meanings.definition: In a secure or stable manner
meanings.sent1: The bookshelf was firmly attached to the wall.
meanings.sent2: She stood firmly on the ground during the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The tent was firmly secured with strong ropes.
meanings.sent4: The foundation of the house was firmly laid to withstand storms.
meanings.sent5: The lock clicked firmly into place, ensuring safety.
